name: Nejc Blaznik
profile: Experimental physicist with a strong background in quantum mechanics, optics and data-driven imaging. Strong blend of laboratory expertise, software engineering and data analysis. Built new imaging methods, custom reconstruction pipelines and robust analysis tools for complex experiments. Interested in problems where physics, computation and instrumentation meet.

experience.role: Ultracold Quantum Gases Laboratory at Utrecht University
points: Operated and maintained a cold-atom experiment with sodium BECs.
Developed and implemented new techniques for spin-resolved off-axis holography.
Designed PCA-based phase reconstruction and background-inpainting pipelines.
Created a Python+PyQt5 analysis suite for controlling the experiment and analysing spin dynamics, spin segmentation, and parameter correlation across experiments.
Performed gate-based reflectometry analysis and noise characterization of superconducting charge islands.
Built Python workflows for signal extraction and device characterization.
Analysed high-resolution X-ray spectra of AGN 3C 273 using SPEX spectral fitting program.
Worked extensively in Unix environments and command-line tools.
Produced quantitative interpretation of absorption and emission features.
Studied weather effects on cosmic-ray detection.
Focused on clear data presentation and statistical interpretation.
Tutored students in physics and mathematics, including intensive revision session.
Developing IB Academy Website, scheduling system and invoicing tools.
Science Correspondent for a Slovenian Magazine.

extracurricular: Gold, Silver and Bronze The Duke of Edinburgh Award
Leadership roles in UCSA committees, managing events and budgets
Founded Hermes, the largest sports committee at UCU
